hackathon-description-text: Innovate Good gives you 24 hours to learn new skills, make friends, create your wildest idea, and share it with the world. Whether you wish to build a website, dabble with Photoshop, create a robotic arm, or develop a game, it's up to you to decide what to learn!
hackathon-rules:
View the FAQ details at https://innovate.hackumbc.org for full set of rules
MLH Code of Conduct
https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This prize track encompasses issues pertaining to physical and mental health, medical care access, and environmental impacts on public health.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Health & Environment  : 4 Renogy E.Flex 5W Portable Solar Panel with USB Port

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The Housing prize track focus asks hackers to think beyond themselves or their school and into their community.
The Education prize track encourages participants to consider education challenges facing schools, teachers, students, and communities both inside and outside the classroom.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Education: 4 Photive BTH3 Over-The-Ear Wireless Bluetooth Headphones

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The Legal/Justice prize track explores issues within the legal system, advocating for the rights of and resources available to others, and addressing systemic problems.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
HackUMBC: SGA Student Life & Involvement Award

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best hack created using Microsoft technologies more information at ter.ps/mshacks
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Health Hack using Microsoft Tech
Focused Support LLC Best Use of 3rd Party API

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=The Commons, 1000 Hilltop Cir, Baltimore, MD 21250, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: This track encompasses issues pertaining to physical and mental health, medical care access, and environmental impacts on public health
The Housing focus asks hackers to think beyond themselves or their school and into their community.
The Legal/Justice track explores issues within the legal system, advocating for the rights of and resources available to others, and addressing systemic problems.
The Education track encourages participants to consider education challenges facing schools, teachers, students, and communities both inside and outside the classroom.

hackathon-location-address: The Commons, 1000 Hilltop Cir, Baltimore, MD 21250, USA
hackathon-description-header: Innovate Good is a social innovation hackathon at UMBC.
